Computer Networks.question: Select the structure or format of data that is stated as ___________.
Select the communication between a computer and a keyboard that defines ______________ transmission.
A _______ defines the physical path over which a message travels.
A _________ defines a set of rules that govern data communication.
Three or more devices share a link in ________ connection.
Identify the collection of various computers that seems a single coherent system to its client.
Two devices are said to be in a network if __________
options: a process in one device is able to exchange information with a process in another device
a process is running on both devices
a process is active and another is inactive
Computer Networks.answer: a process in one device is able to exchange information with a process in another device

Computer Networks.question: In computer networks, nodes are defined as _________.
options: the computer that originates the data
the computer that routes the data
the computer that terminates the data

Computer Networks.question: The communication channel that is shared by all machines is called ________.
A device that forwards packets between networks by processing routing information is called ________.
Network congestion is observed _________.
Which network extends a private network across public networks?
Select the number of layers in the TCP/IP model.
Which layers are extra in OSI model compared to TCP/IP model?
The application layer is observed in ____________.
Which are functionalities of the presentation layer?
Delimiting and synchronization of data exchange is defined by __________.
As a data packet moves from lower to upper layers in OSI model, headers are _______.
Choose the correct statement about OSI model.
options: A structured way to discuss and update system components
One layer may duplicate lower layer functionality
Functionality at one layer does not require information from another layer
It is an application-specific network model
Computer Networks.answer: Functionality at one layer does not require information from another layer

Computer Networks.question: Choose the full name of the OSI Model.
The TCP/IP model does not have the ______ layer, but the OSI model has this layer.
Which layer is responsible for process-to-process delivery?
Which address identifies a process on a host (transport layer)?

The physical layer is concerned with ___________.
Bits can be sent over media as analog signals using ___________.

Wireless transmission of signals can be done via

options: device that allows wireless devices to connect to a wired network
Computer Networks.answer: device that allows wireless devices to connect to a wired network

Which event is not possible in a wireless LAN?
________ topology requires a multipoint connection.
Data communication system spanning states or world is called ______.
In TDM, slots are divided into __________.
Multiplexing technique that shifts each signal to a different carrier frequency.
A TDM link transmits 4000 frames/sec and each slot has 8 bits. Transmission rate = ______
In TDM, the transmission rate of a multiplexed path is always ______ the sum of sources.
Which delay is faced by packet travelling from one end to another?

Time required to examine a packet's header is part of ________.
Server → client file transfer. Rates: 10Mbps, 20Mbps, 30Mbps, 40Mbps. Throughput = ______
Transmission delay does NOT depend on ________.
Propagation delay depends on ________.
Data link layer takes packets from ________ and encapsulates into frames.
Task NOT done by data link layer:
Sublayer that performs medium-dependent data link functions.
Header of a frame generally contains __________.
Automatic repeat request error management mechanism is provided by:
If 2 or more bits change in transmission, error is called ________.
Which of the following is a data link protocol?
Identify the one from the following as the multiple access protocol for channel access control.
Technique of temporarily delaying outgoing acknowledgements so they can be hooked onto the next outgoing data frame is called ________.
In open-loop control, policies are applied to ________.
Retransmission of packets must not be done when _______.
In Go-Back-N window, timer timeout causes many packets to resend. In Selective Repeat window, the sender resends ________.
Closed-Loop control mechanisms ________.
Primary purpose of the Data Link Layer in OSI model is ________.
options: Data transmission over the physical medium
Computer Networks.answer: Data transmission over the physical medium

Computer Networks.question: Multiple access protocol that uses time slots to divide transmission time.
In Pure ALOHA, a collision is detected ________.
options: Only when two stations transmit simultaneously
Computer Networks.answer: Only when two stations transmit simultaneously

Computer Networks.question: In CSMA/CD, when a collision is detected ________.
options: Both stations stop transmitting and retry later
One station continues, the other waits
Computer Networks.answer: Both stations stop transmitting and retry later

Computer Networks.question: Error detection technique that uses polynomial division to generate a checksum.
Error correction technique that lets receiver correct errors without retransmission.
Purpose of Stop-and-Wait ARQ protocol.
options: Ensure ordered and reliable data transfer
Computer Networks.answer: Ensure ordered and reliable data transfer

Computer Networks.question: Error control protocol that retransmits only lost or corrupted packets.
Piggybacking in networking refers to ________.
options: A protocol for long distance transmission
Combining data and acknowledgment into a single frame
Computer Networks.answer: Combining data and acknowledgment into a single frame

Computer Networks.question: Medium access protocol commonly used in Ethernet networks.
Coding scheme that can detect and correct single-bit errors.
In Slotted ALOHA, a station transmits ________.
options: Only at the beginning of each time slot
Computer Networks.answer: Only at the beginning of each time slot

Computer Networks.question: Purpose of the MAC sublayer.
options: Manage access to shared communication medium
Computer Networks.answer: Manage access to shared communication medium

Computer Networks.question: Error control protocol that maintains a sender's window of unacknowledged packets.
Random access in data transmission means ________.
Hamming Distance helps in error detection by ________.
Access protocol with higher probability of collisions but simple implementation.
Primary purpose of Flow Control in data communication.
Key advantage of Selective Repeat ARQ over Go-Back-N.
Block coding refers to ________.
options: Coding data into fixed-size blocks for error detection
Computer Networks.answer: Coding data into fixed-size blocks for error detection

options: Two colons(::) represent successive zero fields

Computer Networks.answer: Two colons(::) represent successive zero fields

Computer Networks.question: Which statement is false with respect to TCP?

options: Sequence number of previously received byte
Sequence number of next byte to be received
Computer Networks.answer: Sequence number of next byte to be received

options: UDP length = IP length – IP header length
UDP length = UDP length – UDP header length

Computer Networks.answer: UDP length = IP length – IP header length

options: generate executable files from web content
Computer Networks.answer: generate executable files from web content

Computer Networks.question: Main purpose of Leaky Bucket algorithm:
options: To control bandwidth allocation based on token generation
To ensure smooth and regulated data flow
To increase data rate during congestion
Computer Networks.answer: To ensure smooth and regulated data flow

Computer Networks.question: How Leaky Bucket algorithm works:
options: Sends packets at variable rate based on tokens
Sends packets at constant rate regardless of incoming burst
Computer Networks.answer: Sends packets at constant rate regardless of incoming burst

Computer Networks.question: Key difference between Token Bucket and Leaky Bucket:
options: Token Bucket allows bursts, Leaky Bucket does not
Leaky Bucket operates on variable output rate, Token Bucket on constant rate
Token Bucket has no tokens, Leaky Bucket uses tokens
Leaky Bucket generates tokens, Token Bucket controls congestion
Computer Networks.answer: Token Bucket allows bursts, Leaky Bucket does not

Computer Networks.question: In Token Bucket, if no tokens are available when data arrives:
options: Data waits until tokens are available
Computer Networks.answer: Data waits until tokens are available

Computer Networks.question: Best scenario for Token Bucket algorithm:
In Leaky Bucket, if incoming traffic exceeds bucket output capacity:

options: Speeds up and improves decision making

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Select the primary purpose of a histogram in data analysis.
options: To show the relationship between two variables
To summarize the distribution of a dataset
To calculate the mean and median of the data
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: To summarize the distribution of a dataset

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Choose the main advantage of using a histogram over a bar chart.
options: A histogram can display multiple variables simultaneously while a bar chart cannot.
A histogram shows the distribution of continuous data while a bar chart compares discrete data categories.
A histogram is better at showing relationships between variables compared to a bar chart.
A histogram is more suitable than a bar chart for displaying categorical data.
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: A histogram shows the distribution of continuous data while a bar chart compares discrete data categories.

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Choose the primary goal of data analytics.
options: To gain insights from the data
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: To gain insights from the data

Storing and processing vast amounts of data, particularly big data, across clusters of computers

Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: They can improve model performance and reduce overfitting.

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Choose the main characteristic of supervised learning.

It relies on historical data with known outcomes.

Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: It relies on historical data with known outcomes.

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Select the unsupervised learning method from the following options.

To divide data into training and testing sets.

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Choose the correct five Cs in ethics.
options: Categorization, Compliance, Confidentiality, Communication, and Consequences
Care, Compassion, Courage, Communication, and Commitment
Character, Culture, Compliance, Consequences, and Context
Confidentiality, Consistency, Communication, Consequences, and Compliance
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: Character, Culture, Compliance, Consequences, and Context

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Among the five Cs in the context of ethics, what does 'Character' refer to?
options: The moral integrity and virtues of individuals
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: The moral integrity and virtues of individuals

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: What is the role of 'Compliance' in the five Cs of ethics?
options: It focuses on the consequences of actions.
It concerns the legal and regulatory requirements.
It emphasizes communication within an organization.
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: It concerns the legal and regulatory requirements.

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Which of the five Cs is primarily concerned with the outcome or results of ethical decisions?
In recent ethical trends, what does Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) focus on?
options: Maximizing shareholder profits at all costs
Balancing ethical obligations with financial success
Prioritizing individual interests over collective well-being
Ignoring the impact of business operations on society
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: Balancing ethical obligations with financial success

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Select the significant trend in ethical considerations regarding data privacy and cybersecurity.
options: Neglecting data protection in favor of business growth
Increased emphasis on securing personal data and privacy
Minimizing the importance of data breaches and cyber threats
Promoting unrestricted access to personal information
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: Increased emphasis on securing personal data and privacy

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Select the trend that has emerged in recent years in environmental ethics and sustainability.
options: Ignoring environmental concerns for economic gain
Stronger emphasis on eco-friendly practices and sustainability
Disregarding the impact of businesses on the environment
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: Stronger emphasis on eco-friendly practices and sustainability

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: Select the option regarding recent trends in workplace ethics that has been impacted by technological advancements.
options: They have led to increased unethical behavior in the workplace.
They have facilitated remote work and ethical concerns around privacy.
They have reduced the need for ethical considerations in the workplace.
They have made it difficult to address ethical issues.
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: They have facilitated remote work and ethical concerns around privacy.

Data Analytics and Reporting.question: In recent trends related to ethical decision-making, what is the significance of Whistleblower Protection?
options: It discourages employees from reporting unethical behavior.
It provides legal safeguards for individuals reporting misconduct.
It promotes unethical behavior within organizations.
It encourages unethical practices within the workplace.
Data Analytics and Reporting.answer: It provides legal safeguards for individuals reporting misconduct.
